Demonstrations and Demonstrative Sciences
6. Demonstrations and Demonstrative Sciences

A demonstration (apodeixis) is “a
deduction that produces knowledge”. Aristotle’s
Posterior Analytics contains his account of demonstrations
and their role in knowledge. From a modern perspective, we might think
that this subject moves outside of logic to epistemology. From
Aristotle’s perspective, however, the connection of the theory
of sullogismoi with the theory of knowledge is especially
close.
